The Pmax-to-PVO2max ratio [was not significantly different](https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fphys.2018.00387/full) between children (1.9 ± 0.5) and endurance athletes (2.1 ± 0.2) but lower than untrained men (3.2 ± 0.3, p < 0.001 for both).

The Pmax-to-PVO2max ratio **was similar** between children (1.9 ± 0.5) and endurance athletes (2.1 ± 0.2) but lower than untrained men (3.2 ± 0.3, p < 0.001 for both).
